data.title: LBank's trading volume increased by 35% month-on-month in October, with a total airdrop value of $520,000.
data.description: Official data shows that LBank's trading volume increased by 35% month-on-month in October, with listed assets averaging a 612% increase and a total airdrop value of $520,000. The top five performing listed assets were: HAJIMI (+3900%), 4 (+3794%), NPCZ (+2038%), SORA (+1370%), and PAYAI (+875%). According to a CoinGecko report, LBank performed exceptionally well in terms of the proportion of 100x coins; its listed assets saw monthly gains exceeding those of other CEXs by 90%, and it maintained a leading share in the meme asset market.

data.title: Bitcoin(BTC) Drops Below 110,000 USDT with a Narrowed 0.34% Increase in 24 Hours
data.description: On Nov 01, 2025, 06:42 AM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has dropped below 110,000 USDT and is now trading at 109,987.109375 USDT, with a narrowed narrowed 0.34% increase in 24 hours.

data.title: Binance Alpha will list Marina Protocol (BAY), with a first-phase entry threshold of 245 points.
data.description: Binance Alpha will list Marina Protocol (BAY), and Alpha trading will open on November 1, 2025 at 16:00 (UTC+8). Eligible users can claim an airdrop of 400 BAY tokens using Alpha Points within 24 hours of the trading start date. The airdrop will be conducted in two phases: Phase 1 (first 18 hours): Users with at least 245 Alpha Points can claim the airdrop. Phase 2 (last 6 hours): Users with at least 230 Alpha Points can participate in the airdrop on a first-come, first-served basis. If the rewards are not fully distributed, the Alpha Points threshold will automatically decrease by 15 points every hour.

data.title: Binance Alpha will launch THORWallet (TITN) on November 3rd.
data.description: According to an official announcement, Binance Alpha will launch THORWallet (TITN) on November 3rd. Eligible users can claim the airdrop using Binance Alpha Points on the Alpha event page after trading opens. More details will be announced soon.

data.title: Young Investors Dominate India's Leading Crypto Platform
data.description: According to PANews, a recent report by CoinSwitch, India's largest cryptocurrency exchange, reveals that investors aged 18-25 currently make up 37.6% of its user base. Millennials, aged 26-35, closely follow with a 37.3% share, while those aged 36-45 account for 17.8%. In terms of geographic distribution, major cities continue to lead, with Delhi at the forefront, representing 19.3% of users, followed by Bangalore at 8.9% and Mumbai at 7.0%.

data.title: Analysis: The BTC supply structure is rapidly tightening, and significant volatility is imminent.
data.description: Analyst Murphy stated on the X platform that the current concentration of BTC holdings within 5% of the spot price has risen to 17.6%, the highest in nearly two years. This indicates that the holdings structure is rapidly tightening, and after the energy accumulates, a potentially large fluctuation is imminent. On September 30th, the concentration of BTC holdings within 5% of the spot price rose to 15%, and shortly afterward, BTC experienced a strong rebound that broke through its all-time high. Looking at the performance of this data over the past two years, there have been eight instances where the concentration exceeded 13%, and BTC experienced varying degrees of volatility afterward each time. However, volatility measures price amplitude, not direction; price movements are unpredictable and lack any discernible pattern. What is relatively certain is that significant volatility is imminent.

data.title: EtherFi Investigates Alleged Credit Card Fraud Concerns
data.description: According to Odaily, EtherFi CEO Mike Silagadze has addressed community concerns regarding potential upstream and downstream issues within the company. These concerns arose after reports surfaced of a credit card, which had never been used for any transactions or pre-authorizations, being fraudulently charged. Silagadze stated that the company is actively investigating the matter and is in communication with its credit card partners. He assured that all users affected by fraudulent transactions will receive refunds.

data.title: EtherFi CEO: We are investigating the fraudulent use of EtherFi cards; all affected users will receive a refund.
data.description: In response to concerns circulating in the community that "EtherFi may be experiencing upstream and downstream issues, with a card that has never been used for any transactions/pre-authorizations being fraudulently used and suspended," EtherFi CEO Mike Silagadze stated, "We are investigating this matter and communicating with our credit card partners. All users who experienced fraudulent transactions will receive a refund."

data.title: Analysis: The "Bitcoin price will inevitably fall after halving" pattern may have broken down, and a stable bull market may continue.
data.description: In the past, Bitcoin halvings were accompanied by dramatic price fluctuations, but this time the market has been remarkably calm. Data analytics website CoinGlass shows that Bitcoin's volatility is currently below 2%, a historical low. Around the time of the third halving in 2020, Bitcoin volatility exceeded 5%, but this time the situation has changed significantly. Keiji Maeda, an executive at the Japanese crypto company Backsea, believes that the rule of thumb for Bitcoin halvings has broken down, and a stable bull market may continue. With increased market liquidity, the influence of short-term trading by individual investors has weakened; it can be said that the self-fulfilling prophecy of the rule of thumb driving speculative selling is no longer able to sway the market. (Nikkei News)

data.title: Polymarket predicts an 88% chance of GEN.G winning the League of Legends match against KT.
data.description: According to Polymarket data, the "League of Legends GEN.G vs KT" match saw over $1.26 million in trading volume, with GEN.G having an 88% winning probability in a best-of-five (Bo5) series.

data.title: Crypto KOL ChainOpera recently completed a $40 million funding round, bringing its total funding to over $50 million.
data.description: According to KOL Crypto Fearless, AI Layer 1 project ChainOpera recently completed a funding round of over $40 million, but the funding method, valuation, and participating institutions were not disclosed. After ChainOpera's token COAl was listed on Binance Alpha and its contracts on September 25th, its price dropped to a low of $0.13. The token then began a continuous rise from October 6th, reaching a high of $20, before currently settling around $1.50. It is understood that in December 2024, ChainOpera announced the completion of a $17 million seed round, led by Finality Capital, Road Capital, and IDG Capital. With this latest funding round of over $40 million, ChainOpera has raised over $50 million in total.

data.title: Bitcoin's Volatility Remains Low Amid Halving Period
data.description: According to Odaily, the current Bitcoin halving period is marked by an unusual calm in the market, contrasting with the significant price fluctuations seen in previous cycles. Data from CoinGlass indicates that Bitcoin's volatility is now below 2%, reaching historical lows. In contrast, during the third halving period around 2020, volatility exceeded 5%. Keiji Maeda, an executive at Japanese crypto company BACKSEAT, suggests that the traditional expectations for Bitcoin halving periods have collapsed. He believes that a stable bull market may continue as market liquidity increases, reducing the impact of short-term trading by individual investors. The self-fulfilling nature of speculative selling driven by past experiences appears to have diminished in its ability to influence market trends.

data.title: AI video generation company Synthesia raises $200 million in funding, led by Google Ventures.
data.description: According to Forbes, Synthesia, a UK-based AI video generation company, has completed a new $200 million funding round, valuing the company at $4 billion. This round was led by Google Ventures, with Nvidia potentially participating. Synthesia had previously raised $280 million, with Nvidia and Adobe among the investors. Founded in 2017, Synthesia differs from video generation tools like Sora in its focus, concentrating on helping businesses use AI-generated avatars to create videos for marketing, employee training, and more. Currently, 60,000 companies are using Synthesia's platform to generate their own avatar videos.
